xplore a couple sites where good equipment is available to buy off the shel=
f that will give evp results.=A0=A0 Here=A0is stuff you might find useful.=
=A0 You can always build your own as you move along in the process.=A0 I am=
 glad you are with us.=A0 I have some technical questions you might be able=
 to help research...like learning about the frequencies of "their" transmis=
sion etc.=A0=A0 but I ll save that.=A0 Ron l

http://paranormalsyste=
ms.com=A0Ron Ricketts=A0has a Mini Box II that has all the bells a whistles=
 you can want.=A0 Recommended even by Frank S. 
=A0 
www.UFOGeek.com defini=
tely check this out because Mike Coletta (a member) shows you how to hack a=

d can cost less that $25.=A0=A0

 The ovilus, a portable hand-held unit and=A0the Puck=A0a computer based un=

buy.

Then there is=A0EVP=
 Maker w/allophone file at http://www.keyportparanormal. com/evpsoftware. h=
tml=A0=A0=A0 This I believe is free to download to your computer and is a p=
roven system for EVP.=A0

Hope this helps.=A0 Personally, I like the R=
adio Shack 125 as a starter.=A0 Proven by many here.=A0 I have an Ovilus, E=

--- On Sun, 10/26/08, mercifulrelease <mercifulrelease@yahoo.c=
om> wrote:

From: mercifulrelease <mercifulrelease@...>
Subject: [EVP=
-ITC] New member hello
To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com
Date: Sunday, October 26=
, 2008, 6:52 PM






Hi Everyone!

I'm new and I stumbled onto this group =
after doing some research
online into EVP. I consider myself to be a parano=
rmal skeptic, but I
have heard some very interesting EVP evidence and would=
 like to look
into it further. I joined this group because I am interested =
in
submitting EVP data to some rigorous scientific analysis. I'm an
electri=
cal engineer and mainly work in the areas of signal processing
and communic=
ations so all of this is extremely interesting. 

I am interested in collec=
ting some of my own data (at some point) by
building a ghost box based on F=
rank Sumption's designs. I am working
from the "Ghost Box Notebook" from 20=
07, but I am having a hard time
getting started. Has anyone built one of th=
ese and are there any
parts lists or more complete schematics floating arou=
nd? I would
appreciate any build help or advice any of you might have.

Reg=
ards,

Anna

<table cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" border="0" ><tr><td valign="top" style="font: inherit;"><DIV id=yiv1130548152>
<DIV>Hi Anna    I am normally not a greeter for the group but I see everyone is a bit slower than normal in responding to a new member.  Welcome.   I am certain others can answer your technical questions better than I so I will not attempt to here.  Let me suggest that you take a look at other alternatives that will allow you to begin doing <SPAN class=yshortcuts id=lw_1225115785_0><SPAN>evp</SPAN> recordings</SPAN> yourself in a blink of the eye and with less than $50 invested.  You can also explore a couple sites where good equipment is available to buy off the shelf that will give evp results.   Here is stuff you might find useful.  You can always build your own as you move along in the process.  I am glad you are with us.  I have some technical questions you might be able to help research...like learning about the frequencies of "their" transmission etc.   but I ll save
 that.  Ron l</DIV>
<DIV>
<P class=MsoNormal><SPAN style="COLOR: black; FONT-FAMILY: 'Calibri', 'sans-serif'"></SPAN></DIV></DIV>
<P class=MsoNormal><SPAN style="COLOR: black; FONT-FAMILY: 'Calibri', 'sans-serif'"><SPAN class=yshortcuts id=lw_1225113441_1 style="BACKGROUND: none transparent scroll repeat 0% 0%; CURSOR: hand; BORDER-BOTTOM: medium none"></SPAN></SPAN>
<P class=MsoNormal><SPAN style="COLOR: black; FONT-FAMILY: 'Calibri', 'sans-serif'"> </SPAN> 
<P class=MsoNormal><SPAN style="COLOR: black; FONT-FAMILY: 'Calibri', 'sans-serif'"><A href="http://paranormalsystems.com/" target=_blank rel=nofollow><SPAN style="COLOR: blue">http://paranormalsystems.com</SPAN></A> R</SPAN>on Ricketts has a Mini Box II that has all the bells a whistles you can want.  Recommended even by Frank S. 
<P class=MsoNormal>  
<P class=MsoNormal>www.<A href="http://ufogeek.com/" target=_blank rel=nofollow><SPAN class=yshortcuts id=lw_1225113711_9><FONT color=#003399>UFOGeek.com</FONT></SPAN></A> definitely check this out because Mike Coletta (a member) shows you how to hack all the <SPAN class=yshortcuts id=lw_1225115785_1>radio shack radios</SPAN> so they can be used for EVP.  They work fine and can cost less that $25.   
<P class=MsoNormal>  
<P class=MsoNormal><A href="http://www.digitaldowsing/" target=_blank rel=nofollow><SPAN class=yshortcuts id=lw_1225115785_2><FONT color=#003399>www.digitaldowsing</FONT></SPAN></A>. com ---Bill sells The ovilus, a portable hand-held unit and the Puck a computer based unit.  Uses speakjet computer generated sounds.<BR>buy.<BR>
<P class=MsoNormal>Then there is EVP Maker w/allophone file at <A href="http://www.keyportparanormal.%20com/evpsoftware.%20html" target=_blank rel=nofollow><FONT color=#003399>http://www.keyportparanormal. com/evpsoftware. html</FONT></A>    This I believe is free to download to your computer and is a proven system for EVP.  
<P class=MsoNormal>  
<P class=MsoNormal>Hope this helps.  Personally, I like the Radio Shack 125 as a starter.  Proven by many here.  I have an Ovilus, Evpmaker and just ordered the Mini Box II.  Good luck.   ron l 
<P class=MsoNormal><BR>  
<P class=MsoNormal>  
<P class=MsoNormal>  <BR><BR>--- On <B>Sun, 10/26/08, mercifulrelease <I><mercifulrelease@...></I></B> wrote:<BR>

<DIV id=yiv746463992>
<DIV id=ygrp-text>
<DIV>Hi Everyone!<BR><BR>I'm new and I stumbled onto this group after doing some research<BR>online into EVP. I consider myself to be a paranormal skeptic, but I<BR>have heard some very interesting EVP evidence and would like to look<BR>into it further. I joined this group because I am interested in<BR>submitting EVP data to some rigorous scientific analysis. I'm an<BR>electrical engineer and mainly work in the areas of signal processing<BR>and communications so all of this is extremely interesting. <BR><BR>I am interested in collecting some of my own data (at some point) by<BR>building a ghost box based on Frank Sumption's designs. I am working<BR>from the "Ghost Box Notebook" from 2007, but I am having a hard time<BR>getting started. Has anyone built one of these and are there any<BR>parts lists or more complete schematics floating around? I would<BR>appreciate any build help or advice any of you might
 have.<BR><BR>Regards,<BR><BR>Anna<BR><BR></DIV></DIV></DIV></BLOCKQUOTE></DIV></td></tr></table><br>
